contentrichtext.text: {{for|the film producer|Jennifer Weiss (producer)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2012}} {{Infobox State Representative | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | imagesize = | name = Jennifer Weiss | state_house=North Carolina | state=North Carolina | district = 35th | term_start = 1999 | term_end = present | preceded = | succeeded = Incumbent | constituency = | majority = | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] | birth_date = <!-- {{Birth date and age|1900|0|0}} --> | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = Bruce Hamilton | alma_mater = [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]], [[University of Virginia School of Law]] | profession = [[Attorney at law (United States)|attorney]] | residence = [[Cary, North Carolina]] | religion = | website = http://www.weissforhouse.com/ }} '''Jennifer Weiss''' (born October 29, 1959<ref name="smart">[http://www.vote-smart.org/bio.php?can_id=MNC13214 Biography] from the [[Project Vote Smart]] website</ref>) is a [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] and a [[Homemaker|stay-at-home mom]].<ref name="about">[http://www.weissforhouse.com/about.htm About Weiss] from her campaign website</ref> She represents the state's thirty-fifth House district, located in [[Wake County, North Carolina|Wake County]].<ref>[http://www.ncga.state.nc.us/gascripts/members/viewMember.pl?sChamber=House&nUserID=198 Biography] from the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] website</ref> Weiss was first elected in November 1999.<ref name="smart" /> She is a chair of the Finance Committee.<ref>[http://www.ncleg.net/gascripts/members/reports/committeeAssignments.pl?nUserid=198&Chamber=H] from the N.C. General Assembly website</ref> In her tenure, she has received the 2007 NC AARP Outstanding Legislator Award, the 2002 NC Press Association William C. Lassiter First Amendment Award, and the 2004 Advocate of the Year from the NC National Association of Social Workers. In 2001, the Town of Cary issued a proclamation honoring Weiss for her legislative accomplishments. In her most recent campaign for re-election<ref name="campaign">[http://www.weissforhouse.com/ Official campaign website]</ref> she ran on a platform of: making North Carolina a great place to live, work, and do business; improving public education; improving the quality of life; and protecting our environment. In 2009, Representative Weiss sponsored and help pass the "Amazon Tax Law" which resulted in the Internet Giant Amazon.com to end their relationship with North Carolina citizens who had been Amazon.com associates. This new law resulted in other large Internet companies to end their affiliate relationships with the residents of North Carolina.{{Citation needed|date=July 2012}} ==Prior to her election== Weiss received her Bachelors degree in Political Science from [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]] in 1981 and her [[Juris Doctor|J.D.]] from the [[University of Virginia School of Law]] in 1986. She practiced corporate and securities law in Boston from 1986 to 1990, at [[Brown, Rudnick, Freed and Gesmer]],<ref name="smart" /> a "100-person firm" where she found the job "exciting and lucrative" though it failed to satisfy her "desire to give back to the community".<ref name="journal">[http://www.ncjournalforwomen.com/months/2004_months/may04/may04bennettwilkes.htm May 2004 article about Weiss] from the [[North Carolina Journal for Women]] website</ref> She resigned five months after her son was born, and the two of them and her husband moved from the Boston area to [[Cary, North Carolina]].<ref name="journal" /> ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{North Carolina House of Representatives}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Weiss, Jennifer | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = October 29, 1959 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Weiss, Jennifer}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:American lawyers]] [[Category:1959 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Women state legislators in North Carolina]] [[Category:People from Cary, North Carolina]]
